column4: Hi, I've got trouble when playing games in fullscreen. The touchpad seems to be too sensitive, compared to when playing in a window
No
OmegaForte: Really, it's not needed in most cases. The system detects on-the-fly most of the settings required.
that clears my worries :D
OmegaForte: I have no idea how to do that, but if it's done in /etc/X11/xorg.conf, you can always create it yourself.
Has this got something to do with that? http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=7152711&postcount=14
Oh, that's not it. This is about the pointer being always visible
Ahh... visible, but is it moving?
It moves too fast here, but only with a touchpad. It ignores the sensitivity
Yes, but too fast. But when I use a mouse it works great!
Ahh... yes, touchpads are evil. I would just disable them altogether, if I had it my way.
Unfortunately there's no space to use a mouse on a move. And when you're bored, games are the solution
There's always IRC, and specifically this channel? :D
Ah, but I usually have no connection. Otherwise I would hang out here on the move
Sorry, I really have no idea what to look for. Like I said, touchpads are evil. I hate mine, and never use it.
I'm starting to too. I'll try to get help with a different problem
No idea what could be going on. What have you recently installed? Maybe take a look at ~/.Xsession-errors. Some people have had problems with Ubuntu One syncs upon login.
Nothing really. Only switched the battery indicator for something better. And .Xsession-errors seems to not have any errors during startup
Sorry, I'm stumped. Good luck with that!
I will keep on trying. It seems some people have the same problem, but no solution anywhere
No! It's still under development!
Unless you really, really, I MEAN REALLY know what you're doing, don't run it.
I know, I run them all the time. But oneiric isn't, at this moment.
I'll wait then
